column4: ok I just installed a harddisk from a defunct bo=x that broke,   its ide,   now I have my system installed on a sata drive... is there a way to access both drives? or are they mutually exclusive,  using sata  /  ide
and if not,  why isn't my sata drive4 showiong up anymore
although that makes no sense since my cd drive is ide...and they worked together ><
as long as both drives are cabled properly and the BIOS is identifying the drive(s) there should be no problem using IDE and SATA drives simultaneously
if you boot into linux with the SATA drive, you should see the IDE drive show up as a /dev/hd* device
I'd thought so,m  the sata drive was alread in this box,  and it has my linux system installed...once I installed the ide drive though,  it keeps trying to boot from that and I have no /dev/sd*
your BIOS is probably set to boot to the IDE driver before the SATA
well thats why im on a live cd now :p
IDE drive rather, not driver
but no /dev/sd
